titleStmt.title: An excellent ballad of the mercers son of Midhurst, and the cloathiers daughter of Guilford To the tune of, Dainty come thou to me.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for and sold by W. Thackeray, at the Angel in Duck-Lane. J.M. and A.M.,

notesStmt.note: The second sheet contains "A ballad, intituled, The old mans complaint against his wretched son, who to advance his marriage, did undo himself. To the same tune" (Wing B602A).
Reproduction of the original in Glasgow University Library.
